description.narrative:
Agriterra supports farmer-led businesses: organizations where farmers are either directly or indirectly in control. This control is in place either because the business is a membership organisation or because agricultural organisations are the shareholders. These agribusinesses – usually cooperatives – become our clients because they see Agriterra as key partners who is capable to capacitate them and contribute to their ambitions in becoming professional cooperatives.

Agriterra uses strict entry and exit criteria for clients. To become a client cooperatives must have at least 1 000 members (possible to deviate if growth potential can be proven) be able to show a track record in business have realistic ambitions for growth recognize the need for finance (working capital and term loans) and be prepared to change.

Clients who show little progress have a vision that differs from Agriterra’s long-term view show no genuine desire to professionalize the business or prove resistant to change perpetrate fraud or malpractice in financial management or suffer from serious governance issues that hamper proper business performance are reasons for an declining a client to be supported by Agriterra.

The goal for 2020 is to conduct 8 assessment for the individual Agriterra clients. Furthermore this project will also be used for registering missions and events that are related with the core objective of the project.

The underlying project aims to facilitate scoping missions as well as missions for company or organisation assessments in Uganda in order to  expand the client portfolio thereby the impact. Under this project the plan is to assess and on-board clients that are not part of consortium projects. Clients that are assessed for interventions under consortium projects will be assessed and included under their specific consortium projects.
